channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: TreeLearn: A Comprehensive Deep Learning Method for Segmenting Individual Trees from Forest Point Clouds
item.description: We trained TreeLearn on forest point clouds of 6665 trees, labeled using the Lidar360 software.

item.title: Hyperspectral Image Denoising via Self-Modulating Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: At the core of the model lies a novel block, which we call spectral self-modulating residual block (SSMRB), that allows the network to transform the features in an adaptive manner based on the adjacent spectral data, enhancing the network's ability to handle complex noise.

item.title: Robust Burned Area Delineation through Multitask Learning
item.description: In this dataset, we provide annotations for multiple tasks, including burned area delineation and land cover segmentation.

item.title: M$^3$Net: Multilevel, Mixed and Multistage Attention Network for Salient Object Detection
item.description: To overcome these, we propose the M$^3$Net, i. e., the Multilevel, Mixed and Multistage attention network for Salient Object Detection (SOD).

item.title: DiaCorrect: Error Correction Back-end For Speaker Diarization
item.description: In this work, we propose an error correction framework, named DiaCorrect, to refine the output of a diarization system in a simple yet effective way.

item.title: Oobleck: Resilient Distributed Training of Large Models Using Pipeline Templates
item.description: Oobleck enables resilient distributed training of large DNN models with guaranteed fault tolerance.

item.title: Multi-Scale Estimation for Omni-Directional Saliency Maps Using Learnable Equator Bias
item.description: This paper proposes a novel saliency-map estimation model for the omni-directional images by extracting overlapping 2-dimensional (2D) plane images from omni-directional images at various directions and angles of view.

item.title: Continual Learning with Deep Streaming Regularized Discriminant Analysis
item.description: Continual learning is increasingly sought after in real world machine learning applications, as it enables learning in a more human-like manner.

item.title: HealthFC: A Dataset of Health Claims for Evidence-Based Medical Fact-Checking
item.description: Seeking health-related advice on the internet has become a common practice in the digital era.

item.title: Robust e-NeRF: NeRF from Sparse & Noisy Events under Non-Uniform Motion
item.description: Such promise and potential of event cameras and NeRF inspired recent works to investigate on the reconstruction of NeRF from moving event cameras.

item.title: Double Domain Guided Real-Time Low-Light Image Enhancement for Ultra-High-Definition Transportation Surveillance
item.description: Real-time transportation surveillance is an essential part of the intelligent transportation system (ITS).

item.title: How Transferable are Attribute Controllers on Pretrained Multilingual Translation Models?
item.description: Given recent progress in pretrained massively multilingual translation models, we use them as a foundation to transfer the attribute controlling capabilities to languages without supervised data.

item.title: T-UDA: Temporal Unsupervised Domain Adaptation in Sequential Point Clouds
item.description: Deep perception models have to reliably cope with an open-world setting of domain shifts induced by different geographic regions, sensor properties, mounting positions, and several other reasons.

item.title: Visual Speech Recognition for Low-resource Languages with Automatic Labels From Whisper Model
item.description: Different from previous methods that tried to improve the VSR performance for the target language by using knowledge learned from other languages, we explore whether we can increase the amount of training data itself for the different languages without human intervention.

item.title: AdSEE: Investigating the Impact of Image Style Editing on Advertisement Attractiveness
item.description: Online advertisements are important elements in e-commerce sites, social media platforms, and search engines.

item.title: SCT: A Simple Baseline for Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning via Salient Channels
item.description: Recently, many parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) methods have been proposed, and their experiments demonstrate that tuning only 1% of extra parameters could surpass full fine-tuning in low-data resource scenarios.

item.title: Local Differential Privacy in Graph Neural Networks: a Reconstruction Approach
item.description: We focus on a decentralized notion of Differential Privacy, namely Local Differential Privacy, and apply randomization mechanisms to perturb both feature and label data at the node level before the data is collected by a central server for model training.

item.title: Physics-informed neural networks for highly compressible flows
item.description: This thesis shows that physics-informed neural networks struggle with highly compressible problems for two independent reasons.

item.title: Optimization of Rank Losses for Image Retrieval
item.description: It provides an upperbound for rank losses and ensures robust training.

item.title: Salient Object Detection in Optical Remote Sensing Images Driven by Transformer
item.description: KTM models the contextual correlation knowledge of two middle-level features of different scales based on the self-attention mechanism, and transfers the knowledge to the raw features to generate more discriminative features.

item.title: FedJudge: Federated Legal Large Language Model
item.description: To this end, in this paper, we propose the first Federated Legal Large Language Model (FedJudge) framework, which fine-tunes Legal LLMs efficiently and effectively.

item.title: Adaptive Priority Reweighing for Generalizing Fairness Improvement
item.description: Our adaptive reweighing method prioritizes samples closer to the decision boundary and assigns a higher weight to improve the generalizability of fair classifiers.

item.title: Towards Last-layer Retraining for Group Robustness with Fewer Annotations
item.description: In this work, we examine this impractical requirement and find that last-layer retraining can be surprisingly effective with no group annotations (other than for model selection) and only a handful of class annotations.

item.title: X-PDNet: Accurate Joint Plane Instance Segmentation and Monocular Depth Estimation with Cross-Task Distillation and Boundary Correction
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we propose X-PDNet, a framework for the multitask learning of plane instance segmentation and depth estimation with improvements in the following two aspects.

item.title: Using Large Language Models for Knowledge Engineering (LLMKE): A Case Study on Wikidata
item.description: In this work, we explore the use of Large Language Models (LLMs) for knowledge engineering tasks in the context of the ISWC 2023 LM-KBC Challenge.

item.title: ChemBERTa-2: Fine-Tuning for Molecule’s HIV Replication Inhibition Prediction
item.description: Two versions of Large Language ChemBERTa-2 models, pre-trained with two different methods, were fine-tuned in this work for HIV replication inhibition prediction.

item.title: Fine-tune the pretrained ATST model for sound event detection
item.description: In this work, we study the fine-tuning method of the pretrained models for SED.

item.title: Breathing New Life into 3D Assets with Generative Repainting
item.description: Diffusion-based text-to-image models ignited immense attention from the vision community, artists, and content creators.

item.title: Syn-Att: Synthetic Speech Attribution via Semi-Supervised Unknown Multi-Class Ensemble of CNNs
item.description: In this paper, a novel strategy is proposed to attribute a synthetic speech track to the generator that is used to synthesize it.

item.title: Unimodal Aggregation for CTC-based Speech Recognition
item.description: Then, the feature frames with unimodal weights are integrated and further processed by a decoder.

item.title: 3D Arterial Segmentation via Single 2D Projections and Depth Supervision in Contrast-Enhanced CT Images
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel method to segment the 3D peripancreatic arteries solely from one annotated 2D projection per training image with depth supervision.

item.title: Beyond Domain Gap: Exploiting Subjectivity in Sketch-Based Person Retrieval
item.description: 2) Multi-perspective and multi-style.

item.title: Characterizing the temporal dynamics of universal speech representations for generalizable deepfake detection
item.description: Existing deepfake speech detection systems lack generalizability to unseen attacks (i. e., samples generated by generative algorithms not seen during training).

item.title: P-ROCKET: Pruning Random Convolution Kernels for Time Series Classification
item.description: Stage 1 of P-ROCKET employs group-wise regularization similarly to our initial ADMM-based Algorithm, but introduces dynamically varying penalties to greatly accelerate the process.

item.title: Large Language Models for Failure Mode Classification: An Investigation
item.description: In this paper we present the first investigation into the effectiveness of Large Language Models (LLMs) for Failure Mode Classification (FMC).

item.title: A Bayesian Approach to Robust Inverse Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We consider a Bayesian approach to offline model-based inverse reinforcement learning (IRL).

item.title: ICLEF: In-Context Learning with Expert Feedback for Explainable Style Transfer
item.description: We propose a framework to augment and improve a formality style transfer dataset with explanations via model distillation from ChatGPT.

item.title: Differentiable Resolution Compression and Alignment for Efficient Video Classification and Retrieval
item.description: To address these issues, we propose an efficient video representation network with Differentiable Resolution Compression and Alignment mechanism, which compresses non-essential information in the early stage of the network to reduce computational costs while maintaining consistent temporal correlations.

item.title: FedDCSR: Federated Cross-domain Sequential Recommendation via Disentangled Representation Learning
item.description: Nonetheless, the sequence feature heterogeneity across different domains significantly impacts the overall performance of FL.

item.title: Reward Engineering for Generating Semi-structured Explanation
item.description: Semi-structured explanation depicts the implicit process of a reasoner with an explicit representation.

item.title: Deep-learning-powered data analysis in plankton ecology
item.description: The implementation of deep learning algorithms has brought new perspectives to plankton ecology.

item.title: Increasing diversity of omni-directional images generated from single image using cGAN based on MLPMixer
item.description: First, since a convolutional layer only processes a local area, it is difficult to propagate the information of an input snapshot picture embedded in the center of the omni-directional image to the edges of the image.

item.title: Deep Nonnegative Matrix Factorization with Beta Divergences
item.description: Deep Nonnegative Matrix Factorization (deep NMF) has recently emerged as a valuable technique for extracting multiple layers of features across different scales.

item.title: Topological Node2vec: Enhanced Graph Embedding via Persistent Homology
item.description: Node2vec is a graph embedding method that learns a vector representation for each node of a weighted graph while seeking to preserve relative proximity and global structure.

item.title: "Merge Conflicts!" Exploring the Impacts of External Distractors to Parametric Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) acquire extensive knowledge during pre-training, known as their parametric knowledge.

item.title: SLMIA-SR: Speaker-Level Membership Inference Attacks against Speaker Recognition Systems
item.description: Our attack is versatile and can work in both white-box and black-box scenarios.

item.title: Towards Large-scale Building Attribute Mapping using Crowdsourced Images: Scene Text Recognition on Flickr and Problems to be Solved
item.description: This work addresses the challenges in applying Scene Text Recognition (STR) in crowdsourced street-view images for building attribute mapping.

item.title: Padding Aware Neurons
item.description: In this work we identify Padding Aware Neurons (PANs), a type of filter that is found in most (if not all) convolutional models trained with static padding.

item.title: Interpretability-Aware Vision Transformer
item.description: Furthermore, if ViTs are not properly trained with the given data and do not prioritize the region of interest, the {\it post hoc} methods would be less effective.

item.title: DiariST: Streaming Speech Translation with Speaker Diarization
item.description: End-to-end speech translation (ST) for conversation recordings involves several under-explored challenges such as speaker diarization (SD) without accurate word time stamps and handling of overlapping speech in a streaming fashion.
